metadata.Title: CVE-2020-27841 on Ubuntu 20.04 FIPS Certified (focal) - low
metadata.Description:
There's a flaw in openjpeg in versions prior to 2.4.0 insrc/lib/openjp2/pi.c. When an attacker is able to provide crafted input tobe processed by the openjpeg encoder, this could cause an out-of-boundsread. The greatest impact from this flaw is to application availability.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-27841` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libopenjp2-7 - 2.3.1-1ubuntu4.20.04.1
libopenjp2-tools - 2.3.1-1ubuntu4.20.04.1
libopenjp3d-tools - 2.3.1-1ubuntu4.20.04.1
libopenjp3d7 - 2.3.1-1ubuntu4.20.04.1
libopenjpip-dec-server - 2.3.1-1ubuntu4.20.04.1
libopenjpip-server - 2.3.1-1ubuntu4.20.04.1
libopenjpip-viewer - 2.3.1-1ubuntu4.20.04.1
libopenjpip7 - 2.3.1-1ubuntu4.20.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: openjpeg2 package in focal was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.3.1-1ubuntu4.20.04.1').
qtwebengine-opensource-src package in focal is affected and may need fixing.
